Detailed Description

A push button that displays an on or off state.

A push button that has three states - on, off, and multiple. For use representing boolean values to the user.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzBoolButton::ButtonState

States for the button. The Multiple state must be set in the code, the user can not select it - if the button is in Multiple state and then toggled (either by the user or the code) the button will switch to false/off.

Enumerator:
BStOff 

Off (false)

BStOn 

On (true)

BStMult 

Indefinite (multiple)

DzBoolButton::DzBoolButton ( QWidget *  parent,
const QString &  trueText = QString::null,
const QString &  falseText = QString::null,
const QString &  name = QString::null 
)

Constructor with params to set text for true/false states.

Parameters:
parent The widget that will be the parent of this button.
trueText Sets the text the button displays if it is on (true). If no text is passed, default is "On".
falseText Sets the text the button displays if it is off (false). If no text is passed, default is "Off".
name The name of the widget.

Set the text for the states of the button

Parameters:
trueText The text that is displayed in the button's true state
falseText The text that is displayed in the button's false state
void DzBoolButton::toggle (  )  [virtual, slot]

Toggle the state of the button. If the current state is on, the state becomes off, and vice versa. If the current state is multiple the state becomes off - after which it toggles on and then off as usual.
